command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.dnb.com'; $user=$env:DNB_USER; $key=$env:DNB_PPK; $hostkey=$env:DNB_HOSTKEY; $remote='/firmographics/daily/duns-enrichment-2025-09-30.json.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\DnB\duns-enrichment-2025-09-30.json.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Transfers a proprietary Dun & Bradstreet firmographic dataset securely via SCP and records a JSON log for auditing.
rationale_steps: Authenticate to a closed-source firmographic data provider using SSH key and host key pinning.
Download a date-specific JSON export in quiet mode to reduce noise.
Hash the file and emit a structured JSON summary for validation.
Focuses on proprietary data acquisition consistent with T1597.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by securely retrieving proprietary Dun & Bradstreet firmographic data via SCP, using environment variables for credentials, and implementing comprehensive logging for audit purposes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, with correct PowerShell syntax, balanced elements, valid flag formats for `pscp.exe`, and proper command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by transferring a proprietary firmographic dataset from a 'closed source' (D&B) using realistic tools and authentication, consistent with an adversary collecting intelligence.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/braces, proper separators, and valid PSCP flags so it parses cleanly.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It aligns with T1597 by retrieving a proprietary D&B dataset and logging it, but likely fails operationally because $host is a read-only automatic variable and it forces SCP against an SFTP-labeled endpoint, reducing plausibility.
